title: Bajrang Dal activist Prashant Poojary murdered in Mangalore; Police arrests 8 Muslims
text:
Bajrang Dal activist Prashant Poojary murdered in Mangalore; Police arrests 8 Muslims By Mohammed Uzair Shaikh on October 21, 2015 at 4:25 PM Comments 
Mangalore, Oct 21: A Bajrang Dal activist, actively involved in beef ban campaigns in Dakshin Kannada region, was brutally assaulted to death by a group of radical Muslims. The deceased has been identified as Prashant Poojary. He was killed in the communally sensitive town of Mangalore. Following preliminary investigation, Karnataka police arrested eight individuals who are accused be part of the group which hacked the 29-year-old to death. 
The gruesome murder was committed on October 9. Poojary, who sells flower on the outskirt of Mangalore was stabbed outside his shop by motorcycle borne killers. Before his death, Prashant revealed the name of attackers to his father. The assassins were all known to Poojary and killed him as an act of revenge, since he played an instrumental role in the closure of Moodabidri slaughter house near Mangalore. (ALSO READ: MM Kalburgi’s peer KS Bhagwan reacts to threatening tweet from Bajrang Dal activist Bhuvith Shetty) 
On Monday, police made the firs break in the case by nabbing four of the accused. Subsequently, four others were also apprehended on Tuesday. The arrested individuals have been identified as - Mohammed Hanif (36), Mohammed Ilyas (27), Ibrahim Liyaqat (26), and Abdul Rashid (39), Mohammed Sharif (42), Mustafa Kavoor (28), Mohammed Mustafa (25), and Kabeer (28). 
“Prashant Poojary was actively involved with a pro-Hindu outfit. There were many clashes and he was attacked out of a communal grudge,” police commissioner K S Murugan was quoted as saying by The Indian Express. 
According to BJP MP from Dakshin Kannada, Naleen Kumar Kateel, the act was in direct retaliation to the closure of slaughtering houses by Bajrang Dal activists. He identified Hanif, one of the workers at the slaughter house, as the one who gave a provocative speech to a group of Muslims following the shut down and promised that he would take revenge.
